instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 00164 ppvcc_s0_cpu
threads.message: Resistance to ground on this rail is 7 Ohms. Way too low?

threads.title: 00164 ppvcc_s0_cpu
threads.message:
Hmm, OK. I only have the Chinese specials with no CPU so nothing for reference.

Board not liquid damaged.
U7501 was dead. Replaced, S5 rails now present.
S5_PWRGD present.

Nothing above S5.
No power cycles / pulsing on any rails.

threads.title: 00164 ppvcc_s0_cpu
threads.message: What about U1900? PPVRTC present? 32Khz present??

threads.title: 00164 ppvcc_s0_cpu
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 34442"]What about U1900? PPVRTC present? 32Khz present??[/QUOTE]

RTC present and 32Khz present.

threads.title: 00164 ppvcc_s0_cpu
threads.message: If U7501 dies it often gets killed through the 5V rail. Check all 5V_s3, s0 for shorts and compare resistance to known good board.
